intro: Friesodielsia affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae, characterized by its succulent leaves and ability to store water. The plant typically has small, green to blue-green leaves arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually pink to red, clustered in dense inflorescences, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Friesodielsia affinis is well adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
